newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - ISSUES TO WATCH - AUG 13.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - ISSUES TO WATCH - AUG 13.

text.p: -- General Dynamics Corp has bid about $1.0 billion for military-vehicle producer United Defence LP, the Wall Street Journal reported.
-- Shares in Applied Materials Inc rose sharply in after-hours trading Tuesday after the company posted third quarter results significantly above analysts' estimates.
-- Teva Pharmaceuticals Industries Ltd traded higher after the close. Earlier in the day the company said it had resolved a manufacturing problem associated with its Clindamycin antibiotic.

-- Crown Cork & Seal Co Inc said after close of trade Tuesday that it would close six manufacturing locations in the U.S., generating an after-tax charge of $0.31 per share in the third quarter. Savings from the actions will total some $20 million in a year, the company said.
-- Federal prosecutors have declared Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp the target of a criminal investigation into whether the company defrauded the federal government, the Wall Street Journal reported.
-- Fleet Financial Group Inc has agreed to buy privately held mutual fund company Columbia Management for $500-$600 million cash, USA today reported.

-- Walt Disney Co's ABC Television said it probably would not use high-definition television to broadcast several new channels during its initial move to digital television, the Wall Street Journal reported.
